TopicTitle: What planet scares you the most?

Articles.Content: It's not really a planet, but minmus scares me most, i've experienced horrible things there.

Ike and Eeloo. Ike is just... a monster that captures you.

Eeloo... *shivers* So far from home.... oh god....

Duna.

I saw some mysterious white smoke on it...
Moho. Use up too much fuel slowing down in interplanetary travel and end up with too little fuel for getting into orbit. Also, the Moholes.

...The kraken.

Honestly I'm not very "afraid" of the planets. Go forth, brave kerbals!

Eeloo and Duna.

Eeloo because every time I go there something goes horribly wrong (kinda like the Mun...)

Duna for more or less the same reason. Either I mess up the transfer or I get something like coming in over a mountain and my chutes didn't deploy early enough to slow me down.
Dres is mine since I have no real reason to go there and its a tough mission there and back.

Bop because there's something on it that was able to kill a Deep Space Kraken

or

Ike because the Magic Boulder has the power to kill a Deep Space Kraken making it equal to the 'thing' that must have killed the Deep Space Kraken on Bop

Jool. When I went in for my first ever flight there (and of now, only....), during the aerobraking, I had targeted slightly too low. I saved my poor laythe rover through making an emergency burn, but the whole time I was over it, I got a horrible feeling, like I was disrespecting something, and that I shouldn't be there. I breathed a huge sigh of relief when I got to laythe, but even then, I still am slightly nervous of it. Duna, on the other hand, feels, sort of like it welcomes you. I havn't gazed upon any other far off worlds yet, but I'm headed there.

Eve. But not because of it's difficulty to escape.

Nobody ever noticed a 'face' on Eve? Those two large lakes on the upper side are the "eyes" and the smaller lake on the bottom is the "mouth". The lake between those two is the "nose".
Eeloo...I only fly with ions, so the amount of solar power i can use is tiny, so the escape burn takes ages.

Toss up between Jool and Eeloo. One you have massive gravity and size, and one wrong move and you are slowly crushed to death as you go down....deeper.....deeper in the great green abyss......

The other is so damn small that you go a hair too fast and you basically zip past it........to slowly die of freezing.......dark.....alone...............
Eve, because of the ridiculous gravity well and atmosphere. I only get comfort from hanging out at Gilly where I have my station.

Eve is a bit scarying cause its thick atmosphÃƒÂ¨re and strong gravity turning the planet almost in a oneway trip for Jeb but Eeloo... So far, so tiny, so hard to reach and so depressing. But the worse is that there surely kraken lurking around, I know that cause it beheaded, my long range huge exploration probe I had so much pain to bring here. I don't want to lose some little kerbals

I remember the first and only time I ever went to Moho. I hadn't seen anything about it yet, and I wanted to explore without knowing what I was going to find. My engines overheated so fast I didn't even notice until it was too late for the crew to survive. Even now, without the atmosphere, I've never gone back. The distance, the inclination, the blasting heat, the oppressive proximity of the sun... it's malevolent.
Bop, I'm not sure why I just feel alone when I visit there.

Mun.

Out of all destinations, it's responsible for most of my ruined rockets.

Even after seemingly successful landings, things get messed up by the complete lack of atmosphere.

Getting a space station in orbit of Mun is no problem, but I haven't managed yet to get one on it.
To be honest, the Mun. Seems very foreboding to me, especially when flying around (or walking around) on the dark side. So close to home, yet so far away.
Mun is a moon, not a planet.
Eve and Eeloo. Thanks to Czokletmuss, I never want to go to Eve. Never. And Eeloo is just isolated, cold, and dark.
Tylo. I went there once. It did not end well.
Dres, dark, isolated, and lonely fun planet to explore though especially in the canyon ,but i hear creepy noises any one agree?
(see below)

Mun is a moon, not a planet.

Semantics!
Gilly. Because: I landed ! Am I rolling? I'm floating... Into the infinite darkness of space.
